CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 23, 1954, page 15, reads: "Vice President Richard M Nixon swunk himself around with the crowd during his busy visit in Pittsburgh Tuesday. Upper left he shakes hands with William pg. Young directory of Republican campaign among Negros at airport while John L. Clair reporter smiling thinks it through. Upper right: Vice President and wife turn from Secret Service men to greet admirers. Center right: at the Nixon luncheon, among others, Atty. Joseph E. Givens, William P. Young, Mrs. Daisy E. Lampkin, Robert Grant, Assistant District Atty. Wendell E. Freeland, Curtis B. Haines, workmen's compensation referee, and Everett McLaine, public relations director, United States Steel. Bottom left: greetings for Republican Senators at Gateway Plaza with Walter (Deep Figure) Rainey in center. Bottom right: faithful ladies of the court, Mrs. Ora Simms, Mrs. V. W. Day and Mrs. Margarey Hardy. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of five men, including Richard Nixon second from right, and woman wearing coat with wide lapels and name tag with elephant, in interior with horse and chariot patterned curtains
